001package org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.datetime;
002
003import java.io.Serial;
004import java.time.Instant;
005import java.time.LocalDateTime;
006import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
007import java.util.Objects;
008import java.util.SequencedMap;
009import java.util.function.Function;
010
011import static org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils.CorePropsUtils.equalProps;
012
013/**
014 * This class is used as a parallel data-structure over the existing linked-map.
015 * To create the instance of that class - use any of factory-methods like {@link #create(SequencedMap, Function)},
016 * {@link #createByEpochSeconds(SequencedMap, Function)} or {@link #createByEpochSecondsInt(SequencedMap, Function)}
017 * <hr/>
018 * TODO: think about making it immutable somehow
019 *
020 * @param <Key> a type of original map's key
021 */
022public class LinkedDateTimeTripletMap<Key> extends LinkedHashMap<Key, LinkedDateTimeTripletMap.LinkedTriplet> {
023
024    @Serial
025    private static final long serialVersionUID = 123456789_001L;
026
027    /**
028     * Extension to {@link DateTimeTriplet} that allows to link that triplet
029     * with sequentially previous and next triplets in corresponding collection or map.
030     * <hr/>
031     * The term <i>linked</i> here means that for neighbour items with the same part of {@link DateTimeTriplet}
032     * the value is not duplicated, but displayed only once (depending on linking direction).
033     * A good example of how it's working is a 'Release Catalog' of this project, where the {@link LinkedTriplet}s
034     * are displayed in the first 3 columns (per each part of triplet), which allows the page to look more friendly
035     * without the duplicated garbage.
036     */
037    public static class LinkedTriplet extends DateTimeTriplet {
038        private LinkedTriplet prev;
039        private LinkedTriplet next;
040
041        void linkPrev(LinkedTriplet prev) {
042            this.prev = prev;
043            prev.next = this;
044        }
045
046        void linkNext(LinkedTriplet next) {
047            this.next = next;
048            next.prev = this;
049        }
050
051        LinkedTriplet(Instant instant) {
052            super(instant);
053        }
054
055        /**
056         * Allows to determine whether to display all three parts of linked triplet (not used now),
057         * comparing all parts of <b>the previous</b> item and this one.
058         *
059         * @return {@code true} if the parts of <b>the previous</b> item is are same as in this one
060         */
061        public boolean isTheSameAsPrev() {
062            return Objects.equals(this, prev);
063        }
064
065        /**
066         * Allows to determine whether to display all three parts of linked triplet (not used now),
067         * comparing all parts of <b>the next</b> item and this one.
068         *
069         * @return {@code true} if the parts of <b>the next</b> item is are same as in this one
070         */
071        public boolean isTheSameAsNext() {
072            return Objects.equals(this, next);
073        }
074
075        /**
076         * Comparing on equality on <b>the first part</b> of triplet with <b>the previous</b> linked value
077         *
078         * @return {@code true} if <b>the previous</b> item exists and has the same property {@link #getYearAndMonth}
079         *          (and {@code false} - otherwise)
080         */
081        public boolean isYearAnMonthTheSameAsPrev() {
082            return equalProps(this, prev, DateTimeTriplet::getYearAndMonth);
083        }
084
085        /**
086         * Comparing on equality on <b>the first part</b> of triplet with <b>the next</b> linked value
087         *
088         * @return {@code true} if <b>the next</b> item exists and has the same property {@link #getYearAndMonth}
089         *          (and {@code false} - otherwise)
090         */
091        public boolean isYearAnMonthTheSameAsNext() {
092            return equalProps(this, next, DateTimeTriplet::getYearAndMonth);
093        }
094
095        /**
096         * Comparing on equality on <b>the second part</b> of triplet with <b>the previous</b> linked value
097         *
098         * @return {@code true} if <b>the previous</b> item exists and has the same property {@link #getDayOfMonthAndWeek}
099         *          (and {@code false} - otherwise)
100         */
101        public boolean isDayOfMonthAndWeekTheSameAsPrev() {
102            return equalProps(this, prev, DateTimeTriplet::getDayOfMonthAndWeek);
103        }
104
105        /**
106         * Comparing on equality on <b>the second part</b> of triplet with <b>the next</b> linked value
107         *
108         * @return {@code true} if <b>the next</b> item exists and has the same property {@link #getDayOfMonthAndWeek}
109         *          (and {@code false} - otherwise)
110         */
111        public boolean isDayOfMonthAndWeekTheSameAsNext() {
112            return equalProps(this, next, DateTimeTriplet::getDayOfMonthAndWeek);
113        }
114
115        /**
116         * Comparing on equality on <b>the third part</b> of triplet with <b>the previous</b> linked value
117         *
118         * @return {@code true} if t<b>he previous</b> item exists and has the same property {@link #getHoursMinutes}
119         *          (and {@code false} - otherwise)
120         */
121        public boolean isHoursMinutesTheSameAsPrev() {
122            return equalProps(this, prev, DateTimeTriplet::getHoursMinutes);
123        }
124
125        /**
126         * Comparing on equality on <b>the third part</b> of triplet with <b>the next</b> linked value
127         *
128         * @return {@code true} if <b>the next</b> item exists and has the same property {@link #getHoursMinutes}
129         *          (and {@code false} - otherwise)
130         */
131        public boolean isHoursMinutesTheSameAsNext() {
132            return equalProps(this, next, DateTimeTriplet::getHoursMinutes);
133        }
134
135        /**
136         * @return the value of {@link #getYearAndMonth()} followed by dash{@code '-'}-symbol,
137         *      if it's not the same as in previous item in sequence (otherwise - empty string)
138         */
139        public String getLinkedYearAndMonth() {
140            return isYearAnMonthTheSameAsPrev() ? "" : getYearAndMonth() + "-";
141        }
142
143        /**
144         * @return the value of {@link #getDayOfMonthAndWeek()}, if {@link #getLinkedYearAndMonth()} is not empty
145         *      and if {@link #getDayOfMonthAndWeek()} is not the same as of the previous item in sequence
146         *      (otherwise - empty string)
147         */
148        public String getLinkedDayOfMonthAndWeek() {
149            return isYearAnMonthTheSameAsPrev() && isDayOfMonthAndWeekTheSameAsPrev() ?  "" : getDayOfMonthAndWeek();
150        }
151
152        /**
153         * @return the value of {@link #getDayOfMonthAndWeek()}, if {@link #getLinkedYearAndMonth()} is not empty
154         *      and if {@link #getHoursMinutes()} is not the same as of the previous item in sequence
155         *      (otherwise - dash{@code '-'}-symbol instead of digits)
156         */
157        public String getLinkedHoursMinutes() {
158            return isDayOfMonthAndWeekTheSameAsPrev() && isHoursMinutesTheSameAsPrev() ? "--:--" : getHoursMinutes();
159        }
160
161        /**
162         * @return the same as inherited {@link #dump()}, but skip displaying the values of parts,
163         *          if they repeat the same of the <b>previous</b> item in sequence
164         */
165        public String dumpLinked() {
166            return String.format("%8s%8s%6s",
167                this.getLinkedYearAndMonth(),
168                this.getLinkedDayOfMonthAndWeek(),
169                this.getLinkedHoursMinutes());
170        }
171
172        /**
173         * @return the same as inherited {@link #dump()}, but skip displaying the values of parts,
174         *          if they repeat the same of the <b>next</b> item in sequence
175         */
176        public String dumpLinkedReversed() {
177            return String.format("%8s%8s%6s",
178                this.isYearAnMonthTheSameAsNext() ? "" : this.getYearAndMonth() + "-",
179                this.isDayOfMonthAndWeekTheSameAsNext() ? "" : this.getDayOfMonthAndWeek(),
180                this.isHoursMinutesTheSameAsNext() ? "--:--" : this.getHoursMinutes());
181        }
182    }
183
184    /**
185     * Private-constructor to force using factory-methods
186     */
187    private LinkedDateTimeTripletMap() {
188    }
189
190    /**
191     * Builds a chronological sequence of {@link LinkedTriplet}s over the original sequence map,
192     * where the passed {@code instantFunc} is used to extract that date-time chronological property
193     *
194     * @param originalMap an original map over any values that has chronological property
195     * @param instantFunc a reference to getter that is used to extract that date-time chronological property
196     * @return the linked-map with the same keys and sequence, but with {@link LinkedTriplet} as value
197     * @param <Key> a type of original map's key
198     * @param <Value> a type of original map's value
199     */
200    public static <Key, Value>
201    LinkedDateTimeTripletMap<Key>
202    create(SequencedMap<Key,Value> originalMap, Function<Value, Instant> instantFunc) {
203        LinkedDateTimeTripletMap<Key> dttMap = new LinkedDateTimeTripletMap<>();
204        originalMap.forEach((Key key, Value value) -> {
205            Instant instant = instantFunc.apply(value);
206            LinkedTriplet dtt = new LinkedTriplet(instant);
207            if (!dttMap.isEmpty()) {
208                dtt.linkPrev(dttMap.lastEntry().getValue());
209            }
210            dttMap.putLast(key, dtt);
211        });
212        return dttMap;
213    }
214
215    /**
216     * The same as {@link #create(SequencedMap, Function)},
217     * but the getter-function {@code epochSecondsFunc} extracts epoch-seconds as {@link Long}
218     *
219     * @param originalMap an original map over any values that has chronological property
220     * @param epochSecondsFunc a reference to getter that is used to extract epoch-seconds as {@link Long}
221     * @return the linked-map with the same keys and sequence, but with {@link LinkedTriplet} as value
222     * @param <Key> a type of original map's key
223     * @param <Value> a type of original map's value
224     */
225    public static <Key, Value>
226    LinkedDateTimeTripletMap<Key>
227    createByEpochSeconds(SequencedMap<Key,Value> originalMap, Function<Value, Long> epochSecondsFunc) {
228        Function<Value, Instant> instantFunc = (Value value) -> {
229            Long epochSeconds = epochSecondsFunc.apply(value);
230            return Instant.ofEpochSecond(epochSeconds);
231        };
232        return create(originalMap, instantFunc);
233    }
234
235    /**
236     * The same as {@link #createByEpochSeconds(SequencedMap, Function)},
237     * but the function that extracts epoch-seconds returns {@link Integer} (not {@link Long})
238     *
239     * @param originalMap an original map over any values that has chronological property
240     * @param epochSecondsIntFunc a reference to getter that is used to extract epoch-seconds as {@link Integer}
241     * @return the linked-map with the same keys and sequence, but with {@link LinkedTriplet} as value
242     * @param <Key> a type of original map's key
243     * @param <Value> a type of original map's value
244     */
245    public static <Key, Value>
246    LinkedDateTimeTripletMap<Key>
247    createByEpochSecondsInt(SequencedMap<Key,Value> originalMap, Function<Value, Integer> epochSecondsIntFunc) {
248        Function<Value, Long> epochSecondsFunc = (Value value) -> epochSecondsIntFunc.apply(value).longValue();
249        return createByEpochSeconds(originalMap, epochSecondsFunc);
250    }
251}
